title: CMakeLists.txt : HAVE_WIN32_WINNT value detection and threadsafe
body:
I use CMake version 3.12.4 and at cofigure time I get error and wrong featire detect:
`curl version=[7.85.0]
Performing Curl Test HAVE_WIN32_WINNT
Performing Curl Test HAVE_WIN32_WINNT - Success
CMake Error at CMakeLists.txt:1170 (math):
  math EXPR called with incorrect arguments.


Found _WIN32_WINNT=0x502 (1)
LTO supported and enabled
Enabled features: SSL IPv6 unixsockets libz brotli zstd AsynchDNS Largefile alt-svc HSTS NTLM HTTP2 HTTPS-proxy unicode threadsafe
Enabled protocols: DICT FILE FTP FTPS GOPHER GOPHERS HTTP HTTPS IMAP IMAPS LDAP MQTT POP3 POP3S RTSP SCP SFTP SMB SMBS SMTP SMTPS TELNET TFTP
Enabled SSL backends: OpenSSL
Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!`

threadsafe should not be enabled in my case and error is from not supported version of math() function:
CMake v3.13+
math(EXPR <output-variable> <math-expression> [OUTPUT_FORMAT <format>])
CMake v3.12 and before:
math(EXPR <output variable> <math expression>)

threadsafe feature detected like this:
`_add_if("threadsafe"    HAVE_ATOMIC OR (WIN32 AND
                        HAVE_WIN32_WINNT GREATER_EQUAL 0x600))`
with is wrong I think - it resolved to TRUE if HAVE_ATOMIC is not zero with any winver 

I get it resolved in my case like this:
`if(WIN32)

  curl_internal_test(HAVE_WIN32_WINNT)
  if(HAVE_WIN32_WINNT)
    string(REGEX MATCH ".*_WIN32_WINNT=0x[0-9a-fA-F]+" OUTPUT "${OUTPUT}")
    string(REGEX REPLACE ".*_WIN32_WINNT=0x" "" OUTPUT "${OUTPUT}")
    math(EXPR HAVE_WIN32_WINNT "${OUTPUT}")
    message(STATUS "Found _WIN32_WINNT=${OUTPUT} (${HAVE_WIN32_WINNT})")
  endif()

  unset(HAVE_WIN32_WINNT CACHE)
endif()

----------------------------------------
_add_if("threadsafe"    HAVE_ATOMIC AND (WIN32 AND
                        (HAVE_WIN32_WINNT GREATER_EQUAL 600)))`
